verses.verse: And Job <S%H347><s%> again took <S%H3254><s%> up his parable <S%H4912><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
As God <S%H410><s%> liveth <S%H2416><s%>, who hath taken away <S%H5493><s%> my right <S%H4941><s%>, And the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>, who hath vexed <S%H4843><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%>:
(For my life <S%H5397><s%> is yet whole <S%H5750><s%> in me <S%H7307><s%>, And the spirit of God <S%H433><s%> is in my nostrils <S%H639><s%>);
Surely my lips <S%H8193><s%> shall not speak <S%H1696><s%> unrighteousness <S%H5766><s%>, Neither shall my tongue <S%H3956><s%> utter <S%H1897><s%> deceit <S%H7423><s%>.
Far be it <S%H2486><s%> from me that I should justify <S%H6663><s%> you <S%H1478><s%>: Till I die I will not put away <S%H5493><s%> mine integrity from me <S%H8538><s%>.
My righteousness <S%H6666><s%> I hold <S%H2388><s%> fast <S%H7503><s%>, and will not let it go: My heart <S%H3824><s%> shall not reproach <S%H2778><s%> me so long as I live <S%H3117><s%>.
Let mine enemy <S%H341><s%> be as the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, And let him that riseth up <S%H6965><s%> against me be as the unrighteous <S%H5767><s%>.
For what is the hope <S%H8615><s%> of the godless <S%H2611><s%>, though he get him gain <S%H1214><s%>, When God <S%H433><s%> taketh away <S%H7953><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%>?
Will God <S%H410><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> his cry <S%H6818><s%>, When trouble <S%H6869><s%> cometh upon him <S%H935><s%>?
Will he delight <S%H6026><s%> himself in the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>, And call <S%H7121><s%> upon God <S%H433><s%> at all times <S%H6256><s%>?
I will teach <S%H3384><s%> you concerning the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God <S%H410><s%>; That which is with the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> will I not conceal <S%H3582><s%>.
Behold <S%H2372><s%>, all ye yourselves have seen it <S%H1892><s%>; Why then are ye become altogether vain <S%H1891><s%>?

This is the portion <S%H2506><s%> of a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H120><s%> with God <S%H410><s%>, And the heritage <S%H5159><s%> of oppressors <S%H6184><s%>, which they receive <S%H3947><s%> from the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>:

If his children <S%H1121><s%> be multiplied <S%H7235><s%>, it is for <S%H3926><s%> the sword <S%H2719><s%>; And his offspring <S%H6631><s%> shall not be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with bread <S%H3899><s%>.
Those that remain <S%H8300><s%> of him shall be buried <S%H6912><s%> in death <S%H4194><s%>, And his widows <S%H490><s%> shall make no lamentation <S%H1058><s%>.
Though he heap up <S%H6651><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> as the dust <S%H6083><s%>, And prepare <S%H3559><s%> raiment <S%H4403><s%> as the clay <S%H2563><s%>;
He may prepare <S%H3559><s%> it <S%H6662><s%>, but the just shall put it on <S%H3847><s%>, And the innocent <S%H5355><s%> shall divide <S%H2505><s%> the silver <S%H3701><s%>.
He buildeth <S%H1129><s%> his house <S%H1004><s%> as the moth <S%H6211><s%>, And as a booth <S%H5521><s%> which the keeper <S%H5341><s%> maketh <S%H6213><s%>.
He lieth down <S%H7901><s%> rich <S%H6223><s%>, but he shall not be gathered <S%H622><s%> to his fathers <S%H6491><s%>; He openeth his eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and he is not.
Terrors <S%H1091><s%> overtake <S%H5381><s%> him like waters <S%H4325><s%>; A tempest <S%H5492><s%> stealeth him away <S%H1589><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>.
The east <S%H6921><s%> wind carrieth him away <S%H5375><s%>, and he departeth <S%H3212><s%>; And it sweepeth <S%H8175><s%> him out of his place <S%H4725><s%>.
For God shall hurl <S%H7993><s%> at him <S%H2550><s%>, and not spare: He would fain <S%H1272><s%> flee <S%H1272><s%> out of his hand <S%H3027><s%>.
Men shall clap <S%H5606><s%> their hands <S%H3709><s%> at him <S%H8319><s%>, And shall hiss him out of his place <S%H4725><s%>.
